JUDGES: András Sajó;Françoise Tulkens;Ireneu Cabral Barreto;Kristina Pardalos;Nona Tsotsoria
TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . Subsequent to his expulsion from a military academy due to his health problems , the applicant brought a case before ORG against ORG ( “ the Ministry ” ) for damages . The applicant argued that the alleged delay in the diagnosis of his medical condition had led to his unfair expulsion , which had inflicted pecuniary and non - pecuniary damages on him .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held a hearing , where it heard the parties and the opinion of the principal public prosecutor , which had previously been submitted to the court in writing . On DATE , relying on the findings of medical experts , ORG refused the applicant ’s claim for damages . On DATE it dismissed the applicant ’s rectification request .
CARDINAL . A description of the relevant domestic law can be found in the decision of GPE v. GPE ( ( dec . ) , no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , DATE ) .
